column1: Member, Graduate Student Advisory Group for Engineering
column8: I'm part of a group that meets directly with the Dean of the School of Engineering to keep him in touch with the graduate student experience. In particular, I serve on the subcommittee for improving advisor-advisee relations.
I organize discussions, socials, and other events to foster a community among graduate women in materials science at MIT.

column1: Graduate Student Mentor, Solar Spring Break
column8: I helped coordinate, mentor, and participate alongside a group of undergraduates who traveled to the Los Angeles area to work with Grid Alternatives installing solar panels on houses in low-income communities.

column1: Student Representative, Energy Education Task Force
column8: I represent graduate student voices on this task force that aims to shape the future of energy education at MIT.

column1: Graduate Student Representative, Solar Test Bed Steering Committee
column8: I represent graduate student researchers on the committee helping to shape the MIT Solar Test Bed, a Campus Living Lab initiative.

column3: Solar Energy Technology & Innovation in Mexico workshop
column8: I helped to organize a workshop in Mexico City about opportunities for solar energy in Mexico in light of the 2014 energy reforms there.
I organized lectures, field trips, and social events around the themes of solar energy and the electricity grid.

column3: Northeast Conference for Undergraduate Women in Physics
column8: I returned to NCUWP as a graduate student to serve on a panel at the 2015 confeence!
Demonstrating hands-on science experiments for kids.
I helped to run a solar energy advocacy group on campus and taught "Solar 202," a workshop about the science of solar energy.
I organized lectures (by both students and guests) and social events in the undergraduate physics community.

column3: Northeast Conference for Undergraduate Women in Physics
column8: I served as the treasurer of the organizing committee for the 2012 NCUWP, held at Yale.
